items.jobDescribe:
必要条件：5年以上制造业工作经验

主要职责：
1，全面负责公司人力资源部的各项管理工作，统筹管理人力资源部六大模块的工作开展。
2，重点开展人力资源部的培训和绩效考核工作。
3，完善人力资源管理体系，优化和引进好的人力资源管理模式（包括提高招聘效果，加强培训，优化绩效制度、薪酬及促进员工发展等），优化和完善人力资源管理制度。
4，负责制定公司的人才发展计划，建设好人才梯队，制定培训和绩效管理制度，以提高员工的工作绩效和职业能力。
5，负责公司的整体企业文化建设，指导员工职业生涯规划，及时处理解决人力资源管理过程中的相关问题。
6，领导安排的其他工作。

职位要求：
1，本科或以上学历，人力资源相关专业。
2，5年以上制造业人事经理工作经验，熟悉人事资源六大模块，业务型人力资源管理经验，擅长培训模块优先。
3，对于制造业各部门体系和岗位熟悉，具有一定的管理经验。
4，具备良好的沟通技巧和人际关系，抗压能力强。

岗位方向：全面负责公司人事部日常管理工作，负责团队管理。

负责公司的人事行政管理和后勤保障工作，包括招聘、培训、员工关系维护、薪酬福利等方面的工作。
主要职责：
- 招聘：负责公司招聘工作的管理和执行，包括发布招聘信息、筛选简历、面试安排等。
- 培训：负责公司员工培训工作的管理和执行，包括制定培训计划、培训讲师安排、培训记录等。
- 员工关系维护：负责公司员工关系管理，包括员工档案管理、员工生日礼品等。
- 薪酬福利：负责公司薪酬福利的管理和执行，包括薪资结构调整、福利政策制定等。
- 办公设备维护：负责公司办公设备采购、维护和管理，包括电脑、办公桌椅等。
- 行政后勤服务：负责公司行政后勤服务，包括公司日常办公用品采购、员工食堂管理等。
职位要求：
- 5年以上人事行政工作经验，本科以上学历，有招聘、培训、薪酬福利等方面的工作经验。
- 熟悉人事行政流程和方法，具有出色的沟通协调能力和团队合作意识。
- 熟练掌握办公软件，如Excel、Word、PowerPoint等。
- 具备良好的逻辑思维能力和分析问题的能力，能够独立思考和解决问题。
- 适应快节奏的工作环境，能够承受较大的工作压力。

岗位职责：
1、协助上级制订公司人力资源战略规划及人力资源中、短期工作计划，并确保战略规划和工作计划的有效执行；
2、协助上级构建和完善公司的人力资源管理体系（招聘、培训、绩效、薪酬福利、员工关系、人才发展等），负责对人力资源相关工作管理、执行、监督和完善；
3、做好组织构架的设计和人力结构分析，组织公司年度人才盘点，优化人员结构，提高人力资源效益；
4、依据业务发展需求和各部门的招聘需求编制，制定招聘计划、招聘策略及招聘工作流程；
5、根据年度招聘计划提前储备或接到招聘需求后快速有效的开展招聘活动，选拔优秀人员，保证岗位缺失人员及时到位；
6、完善培训体系建设，组织开展员工培训及评估工作；
7、监控和及时了解各部门人员离职原因，并进行分析，提出改善方案；
8、制定有效的绩效管理体系和制度，指导各部门开展绩效考核工作，合理运用绩效结果，建立有效的激励机制；
9、参与集团企业文化建设；
10、部门团队建设及日常管理工作。
任职资格：
1、统招本科学历，人力资源、管理类相关专业；
2、8年以上人事全模块经验，其中3年以上管理经验，擅长制定并推行人力资源各模块制度，有过0-1体系搭建经验优先；
3、熟悉招聘、绩效、员工关系、薪酬、培训人力资源六大模块；
4、有企业人力资源体系制度搭建和梳理的经验和能力，并能独立制定方案；
5、自我驱动，以目标和结果导向，认同公司价值观；
6、具备良好的沟通能力和管理能力，具备良好的职业稳定性；
7、具有较强的解决问题的能力、较强的抗压能力、较强的应变能力及较强的文字功底；
8、具有较先进的创新的人力资源管理理念、思路和方法；
9、工作主动认真、有责任心、执行力强、主观能动性强、结构性思维强。

items.fullCompanyName: 上海埃姆哈特紧固系统有限公司
items.jobDescribe:
Make A Difference For Those Who Make The World？

It takes great people to achieve greatness. People with a sense of purpose and integrity. People with a relentless pursuit of excellence. People who care about making things better For Those Who Make The World？. Sound like you? Join our top-notch team of 56,000+ professionals in 60 countries who are making their mark on some of the world’s most beloved brands, including DEWALT, CRAFTSMAN, STANLEY, BLACK+DECKER, IRWIN, LENOX and more.

What You’ll Do
We keep your world running seamlessly in ways both unnoticeable and remarkable. Our fastening systems connect the world’s cars and electronics, and our infrastructure solutions build the world’s roads, pipelines and sewer systems.
For manufacturers, our engineered fastening business meets assembly challenges around the world with innovative, customized and integrated solutions and systems. For oil and gas companies, we provide equipment and services for virtually every aspect of onshore and offshore pipeline construction and inspection. And for heavy construction and demolition, our family of powerful mounted and handheld hydraulic products are the undisputed leader in rebuilding infrastructure.
As the Human Resources Manager, you are responsible for managing HR activities while supporting the business growth including developing and implementing a full range of human resources programs while providing leadership in the implementation of various strategic and operational human resource initiatives. They will ensure the linkage of HR strategies with business objectives while being responsible for assuring that HR programs, policies and activities are developed and delivered in an effective and timely manner. This includes but is not limited to, employee relations, leave management, performance management and recruiting.
 
Specifically, you will:
？	Provide the full range of day-to-day HR support for the commercial team, including staffing, employee relations, performance management, organizational development/continuous improvement, benefits, compensation and training & development.
？	Manage all employees relations. Coach and counsel employees and managers in addressing interpersonal and behavioral challenges.
？	Assist in the interpretation and application of company policies through effective guidance for managers and employees, ensuring compliance with local labor requirements/ regulations.
？	Work with recruiting resource to ensure efficient staffing of open positions. This will require use of Workday, our electronic recruiting solution.
？	Lead performance management and compensation processes.
？	Manage benefits program locally, assisting with benefits-related questions. 
？	Influence decision-making with leaders and key business partners
？	Identifies opportunities for improvement in internal processes and makes constructive suggestions for change.
？	Other duties as assigned

Who You Are
You always strive to do a good job…but wouldn’t it be great if you could do your job and do a world of good? You care about quality – at every level. You love to learn and grow and be acknowledged for your valuable contributions. You’re not intimidated by innovation. In fact, you embrace it. You also have: 
？	Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources or related field required.
？	5 - 10 years of progressive HR experience to include leadership
？	Working knowledge of employment law and industry best practices.
？	Capable of influencing business leaders to drive HR initiatives.
？	Proven track record of building strong relationships vertically and horizontally within an organization.
？	Good communication, and interpersonal skills
？	Results oriented mindset with ability to prioritize and complete projects.
？	Self-motivated individual with the desire to succeed and motivate others
？	Must be professional and customer focused
？	Ability to manage confidentiality at all levels
？	Proficient in Microsoft Office including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
？	Workday software experience (preferred) 


How You’ll Feel
？	Grow: Be part of our global company with 20+ brands to grow and develop your skills along multiple career paths. 
？	Learn: Have access to a wealth of learning resources, including our Lean Academy, Coursera？ and online university. 
？	Belong: Experience an awesome place to work, where we have mutual respect and a great appreciation for diversity, equity and inclusion.
？	Give Back: Help us continue to make positive changes locally and globally through volunteerism, giving back and sustainable business practices.

items.jobDescribe:
1.Main Objectives
	This role is both hands-on and strategic and provides expertise in the areas of employee relations, workforce planning, performance management, compensation, employee retention, coaching, development, conflict management and special projects as necessary. This role should be passionate, prepared and ready with the work and help deliver positive change every day. This role is to build a strong HR organizational capability and be a critical leadership member of the company.
2.Area of Responsibility
	Lead and develop HR strategies, priorities, and talent programs in align with Suprajit Group and company’s strategies.
	Build a strong HR organization and capabilities to provide HR expertise. Actively develop HR team members.
	Work with the business and others in HR to develop effective organizational structures and on specific job design and leveling to drive organizational health.
	Secure that the Company is following statutory law and regulations regarding employees and employment.
	Work as an internal consultant for management team on people management.
	Lead and drive talent reviews, individual development plan, succession plan, performance review.
	Partner effectively with other both internal and external HR parties and to design and roll-out HR solutions.
	Evaluate and interpret policy for management/employees and resolve/prevent conflict within the organization. Act positively as a bridge for the company and employee to keep a good employee relation.
	Design and develop training programs to train and develop employees.
	Get involved in recruitment for each white-collar selection to make sure qualified candidate to be hired to meet position requirements.
	Support Health\Safety\Environment management.
	Work with Quality/HSE engineer, attend local authority meeting regarding HSE when necessary and deliver requirement internally.
	Work with Quality/HSE engineer to organize Fire emergency evacuation each year. 
	Take overall leadership of administration.
3.Personal Tasks
	Serve as Human Resources Business Partner responsible for all HR activities. Develop the HR function aligning strategic and corporate objectives. 
4.Main Challenges
	Drive business development
5.Important External Contacts
	Lawyers
	Local authorities
	Recruitment agencies
6.Competence profile (ideal)
	Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in relevant work experience.
	5+ years in HR management experience
	10+ years’ experience in a HR Business Partner or other HR role including coaching, employee relations, recruiting, compensation, training and HR project management or program implementation.
	Knowledge of China labor laws and regulations for employment. 
	Ability to effectively partner with all levels of the organization and positively influence teams.
	Proven planning and organizational skills, attention to detail, ability to handle multiple tasks.
	Outstanding written and verbal communication; must be a clear, concise and persuasive communicator.
	Safety\Health\Environment Management experience is preferred. Trained and certificate on HSE. 
	Production or manufacturing environment experience preferred. 
7.Authority
 Under the direction of GM to take proper suggestions and decisions regarding to human resource activity.
